alert.note: Alert for Houston; Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 2:27PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Houston and western Humphreys Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 227 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Springville to 8 miles south of Bruceton. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waverly, Camden and New Johnsonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
